page.title: 05Saxon Street
page.content: The village of Saxon Street is thought to be so called because it was on a Saxon raiding route.It is part of the parish of Woodditton and has a population of 210.In the village there is a public house,called The Reindeer, and a garage and filling station which also sells sweets and snacks.The village shop, post office and chapel are just outside this block. A large proportion of houses in Saxon Street are Council owned.Many of the older village houses are built in clunch,a feature of many buildings in this area.
